content: Greetings! I'm Ruoyan, a PhD researcher in Planetary Science at the University of Leicester, specializing in exploration of Jupiter¡¯s infrared aurora via ground-based astronomical facilities and space telescopes. I earned a BSc in Astrophysics at the University of California, Santa Cruz in the United States and a MSc in Astronomy at Leiden University in the Netherlands. I am a fellow of the Royal Astronomical Society and I have been serving as a STEM ambassador of STEM Learning, supported by UK Research and Innovation. During my spare time, I travel around and record the beauty of this fascinating planet earth as a freelance travel blogger. I'm also a fan of basketball. Anyone is welcome to have a game with me!

Ruoyan Wang is a PhD Researcher in Planetary Science at the University of Leicester, specializing in exploration of Jupiter¡¯s infrared aurora via ground-based astronomical facilities and space telescopes. He earned a BSc in Astrophysics at the University of California, Santa Cruz in the United States and a MSc in Astronomy at Leiden University in the Netherlands. He is a fellow of the Royal Astronomical Society and has been serving as a STEM ambassador of STEM Learning, supported by UK Research and Innovation.
